name: Cauliflower Curry
description: This cauliflower curry makes such a great weeknight dinner! It's comforting, packed with protein and healthy vegetables, and it's super easy to make. It's vegan, gluten-free, and ready in just 35 minutes!
recipeIngredient: 1-2 cups basmati rice or brown rice

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the rice according to the instructions on the package. Chop the bell pepper into medium-sized pieces. Finely chop the onion and the garlic.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the rice according to the instructions on the package. Chop the bell pepper into medium-sized pieces. Finely chop the onion and the garlic.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the cauliflower into medium-sized florets. Peel the potatoes and cut them into cubes
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the cauliflower into medium-sized florets. Peel the potatoes and cut them into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pan and sauté the onion for 2-3 minutes. Then add the garlic and the ginger and cook for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pan and sauté the onion for 2-3 minutes. Then add the garlic and the ginger and cook for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add the potatoes and cook for 3 more minutes. Add the curry powder, the cumin, and the red curry paste and stir well. Cook for 1 more minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add the potatoes and cook for 3 more minutes. Add the curry powder, the cumin, and the red curry paste and stir well. Cook for 1 more minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add the coconut milk, the vegetable broth, the bell pepper, the cauliflower, and the chickpeas and cook for 20 minutes. Add the frozen peas and cook for another 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add the coconut milk, the vegetable broth, the bell pepper, the cauliflower, and the chickpeas and cook for 20 minutes. Add the frozen peas and cook for another 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Season with salt, black pepper, and lime juice. Serve over the cooked rice and sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: Season with salt, black pepper, and lime juice. Serve over the cooked rice and sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro.
